notes.text:
NVIDIA has released a software update for NVIDIA Networking Bluefield, ConnectX, DOCA, and Mellanox DPDK.
To protect your system, download and install the latest NVIDIA components from the links provided in this document. For earlier evaluation versions, contact your account manager to get access through NVOnline.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:

This publication supersedes and replaces all information previously supplied. NVIDIA Corporation products are not authorized for use as critical components in life support devices or systems without express written approval of NVIDIA Corporation.
notes.title: Terms of Use

notes.text:
NVIDIA has released a software update for NVIDIA Networking Bluefield, ConnectX, DOCA, and Mellanox DPDK.
To protect your system, download and install the latest NVIDIA components from the links provided in this document. For earlier evaluation versions, contact your account manager to get access through NVOnline.
notes.title: Security Update Notes

notes.text:
Customer recommended mitigations for CVE-2025-23261
We recommend taking the following steps:
  • Customers should update to the latest version of NVOS or Cumulus, which includes a fix for this vulnerability.
  • Customers should review their log files and remove any sensitive information that may have been logged.
  • Customers should ensure the logs are sanitized if extracted from the system
notes.title: Mitigation Notes

notes.text:
To protect your system, download and install the latest NVIDIA components from the links provided in this document:
ConnectX-4 FW:  https://network.nvidia.com/support/firmware/connectx4en/
ConnectX-4 LX FW: https://network.nvidia.com/support/firmware/connectx4lxen/
ConnectX-6 De FW: https://network.nvidia.com/support/firmware/connectx6de/
ConnectX-6 Dx FW: https://network.nvidia.com/support/firmware/connectx6dx/
ConnectX-6 Lx FW: https://network.nvidia.com/support/firmware/connectx6lx/
ConnectX-7 FW: https://network.nvidia.com/support/firmware/connectx7/
ConnectX-8 FW: https://network.nvidia.com/support/firmware/connectx8/
DOCA: https://developer.nvidia.com/networking/doca#downloads
Mellanox DPDK: Released as part of DOCA 3.0.0: https://developer.nvidia.com/networking/doca#downloads
Upstream DPDK: https://developer.nvidia.com/networking/dpdk
Cumulus Linux: https://enterprise-support.nvidia.com/s/

product.name: 12.28.4704 to be published by end of September
14.32.1908 to be published by end of September

notes.text: NVIDIA BlueField contains a vulnerability in the management interface, where an attacker with local access could cause incorrect authorization to modify the configuration. A successful exploit of this vulnerability might lead to denial of service, escalation of privileges, information disclosure, and data tampering.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Escalation of privileges, denial of service, information disclosure, data tampering
notes.title: Impacts

cwe.name: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource

notes.text: NVIDIA DOCA contains a vulnerability in the collectx-clxapidev Debian package that could allow an actor with low privileges to escalate privileges. A successful exploit of this vulnerability might lead to escalation of privileges.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Escalation of Privileges
notes.title: Impacts

cwe.name: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource

notes.text: NVIDIA DOCA contains a vulnerability in the collectx-dpeserver Debian package for arm64 that could allow an attacker with low privileges to escalate privileges. A successful exploit of this vulnerability might lead to escalation of privileges.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Escalation of Privileges
notes.title: Impacts

cwe.name: Concurrent Execution using Shared Resource with Improper Synchronization ('Race Condition')

notes.text: NVIDIA Mellanox DPDK contains a vulnerability in Poll Mode Driver (PMD), where an attacker on a VM in the system might be able to cause information disclosure and denial of service on the network interface.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Denial of Service, Information Disclosure
notes.title: Impacts

notes.text: NVIDIA ConnectX contains a vulnerability in the management interface, where an attacker with local access could cause incorrect authorization to modify the configuration. A successful exploit of this vulnerability might lead to denial of service, escalation of privileges, information disclosure, and data tampering.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Escalation of Privileges, Denial of Service, Data Tampering, Information Disclosure
notes.title: Impacts

cwe.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File

notes.text: NVIDIA Cumulus Linux and NVOS products contain a vulnerability, where hashed user passwords are not properly suppressed in log files, potentially disclosing information to unauthorized users.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Information Disclosure
notes.title: Impacts
